website_summaries.verdict: Enjoy the perfect cup of at-home espresso every time with this well-designed machine.
pros: The hopper and the burrs are easy to remove and clean
The machine grinds quickly, producing fine, fluffy grinds with no clumps
It takes only 6 seconds to grind the perfect double shot of espresso
We found there was little to no grind retention
The modern, sleek design will bring a new aesthetic to your countertop
cons: Grinder is for espresso only and not ideal for medium or coarse grinds

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I was on my second Capresso Infinity grinder and it was starting to become inconsistent with its grinds. I don't do espresso, just grinding for a Moccamaster drip coffee maker. The Baratza is a very high quality piece. The Technivorm likes a fairly coarse grind and this delivers perfectly. I especially like the fall through grinding action where nothing is wasted. It's a bit on the loud side but no worse than several other kitchen appliances we use. I waited over six months of use to write a review to ensure it was dependable and it's been perfect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Does a nice job grinding but build quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: I returned the Sette 30 after the second fuse blew. Customer support sent me a new fuse and I wish I hadn't opened the case--clearly cheap components inside. This was built to a low price point and it shows. Despite serious concerns about build quality and durability, it grinds very fine. Ended up spending more money and getting a used, strong and well-made Italian grinder.
customer_reviews.author: HowardK

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder but not so great on durability of the hopper
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for the price and is the perfect match for any consumer or entry level espresso machine. We use this with our Gaggia Baby and it produces a perfect grind every time. Easy to clean as well. The materials this grinder was made with do seem cheap however, specificly the hopper. I was disappointed that one of the legs on the hopper broke off, and I am not sure how that even happened. I never over twisted when setting in to place, as it's so easy to seat the hopper, and unseat it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Willems

customer_reviews.title: Great design, though it is on the louder side
customer_reviews.text: Very fast grinder and very little retention. Great design, though it is on the louder side. Good for espresso if using pressurized baskets only. If using for filter or pour over, purchase the BG burr from Baratza (~$30) to go coarser and more consistent, which should be included IMO. If your goal is to use standard espresso baskets, this model won't cut it - go for the 270 models. Overall, still the best grinder at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: MrMedley

customer_reviews.title: Baratza Sette 30 AP:  espresso grind options galore in an elegant package
customer_reviews.text: The Sette 30 AP conical burr grinder allows coffee to fall neatly into the supplied cup or directly into your portafilter. Tips: Baratza recommends setting 7 - 10 for espresso. That’s very fine and can clog portafilters. I ended up using 20 to start. (1 is the finest powder, and 31 is the coarsest grind. Start with less time than you think you need. I used two three-second grinds to fill my portafilter. Grind for three seconds, tamp, grind for three seconds, tamp. Then lock into place and extract that freshly-ground goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Western Electric

customer_reviews.title: Grinder is excellent for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Grinder is excellent for 6 months then it just died. Called company and poor customer service
customer_reviews.author: Miles N.

customer_reviews.title: Great basic grinder, but splatters everywhere
customer_reviews.text: march-I’m still testing out the grind size for my espresso machine, it’s doing what it’s suppose to do in terms of grinding. I don’t know why it splatters everywhere! I’m not sure if the static is due to being new machine or because the coffee I used is oily? See attached picture july 2020 update- the coffee no longer gets 'stuck', the static has gone away after a few weeks. after many tests done i have found that the grind setting on 10 works best for my Rancilio silvia (4.75 secs). anything lower than that gets my machine clogged/choke.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This item died today / Updated 9-9-2020
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed but no longer. I can’t believe this item would die after just two years. _________________________ I reached out to the Baratza customer service department and through a series of troubleshooting guides we were able to determine the cause of the issues. Baratza mailed me a replacement motherboard and my grinder is back in business! Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: LOUD LOUD LOUD
customer_reviews.text: This was mentioned in a few reviews, but I did not understand how LOUD this thing is. I had to return it. Woke up the entire house. I need to wake myself up, not everyone else. Did I mention LOUD? Very good even grinds. I like the operation. Minor nit: setting the grind time to the nearest 1/100 of a second is just silly - makes changing the time more persnickety than needed. I agree with other reviewers that grounds tend to end up spilling. Everything was either great or livable, except the NOISE.
customer_reviews.author: mister practicality

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold a consistent enough grind for consistent espresso
customer_reviews.text: The adjustability of this is extremely inaccurate. Once adjusted it does not grind consistent enough for good espresso. 3 shots in a row would pull with wildly different results. I upgraded to the sette 270 and it is far more consistent once set, if not entirely accurate to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Gambill

customer_reviews.title: Works well but sloppy.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to find tune. But if you're using direct to port a- filter it is very sloppy. You must hold it the entire time. Support is just to hold a little weight, doesn't put porta anywhere near output.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Glazen

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for pour over grinding so I'm using it on the largest grain size setting 30. I look forward to using it every morning. Even then it's a bit small but works perfectly for my needs. Would be quite small for french press or cold brew, so the larger burr would be a good addition if you need that.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, modern design. Comparatively affordable
customer_reviews.text: It’s working great. Not too loud, through-grind design means there isn’t a large area for grounds to collect. Easy to adjust and disassemble. Very consistent grind. Easy to swap out burrs if doing cold brew/french press.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: Baratza is known for 2 things. Short life products and good customer service. My item arrived DOA. I will not be purchasing from them again. You can purchase one and rest assured that they will keep sending products until one works, but I'm going with another company that's more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fine grinder
customer_reviews.text: Grinds the way it should. I use it daily without issue. Oily beans are a bit of an issue but other than that the grinder does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Trankonia

customer_reviews.title: Best Grinder I have owned thus far
customer_reviews.text: Grin was very consistent .. Left it at factory setting and it made very very good coffee ! .. I am so glad I have a quality instrument .. I don't grid espresso so I don't know how it does their .. I can say that one should always use a small soft tool to knock out the grinds that don't fall ..
customer_reviews.author: PhaTz

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality grinder you can get at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I wanted the wi but it was 2x's the price. I bought a $10 scale on amazon and i am pulling excelent shots on a consistant basis. Also for a home barista using a consumer espresso machine the 30 settings on this model are enough, you don't need the 270.
customer_reviews.author: Scott flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Grinds well, looks good on the counter
customer_reviews.text: Grounds come out uniform - and quickly. It’s loud, but fast.
customer_reviews.author: T. K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem after two and a half years of ownership, called their 800 number as a last ditch effort and received incredible customer service! A great company that makes great grinders!
customer_reviews.author: AlbertC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality machine
customer_reviews.text: The lack of instructions was the big negative but we figured out how to operate it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for espresso. Just a little to fine of a grind for drip but you can purchase the extra burrs which I recommend for drip and pour over.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Shoemake

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Can’t return
customer_reviews.text: Product now will not grind. Thoroughly disappointed. Had this for less than 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Antifragilista

customer_reviews.title: it's wonderful. Fast
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's wonderful. Fast, not too noisy and grinds the coffee beautifully. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: d from nyc

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. We use for express shots for our Gaggia Classic. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: MichaelO

customer_reviews.title: Great seller
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is perfect for my Gaggia Classic. The seller shipped on time, and the grinder came as expected.
customer_reviews.author: bradley petrinec

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I want it to do very well
customer_reviews.text: The grind through design works. There is virtual.y no retention. Clean is very easy. One of the best purchases I have ever made related to kitchen appliances. Pay attention: this is not the grinder for you if you want cold brew or maybe even French press. It doesn't, by design, grind all that course.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grind
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, works exactly how I wanted. It is noisy as stated in most reviews, but it’s very fast so the noise is tolerable. It also creates no mess, and repeats the same grind quantity flawlessly and consistently. Plus it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: After six months of use, it has stopped working completely. It was an excellent grinder! Quick, sturdy, and I thought reliable. I'm going to try a different brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: joshua brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grinder!! not static at all. Really impressed. But this is for only espresso coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kim

customer_reviews.title: 110V equipment not suitable for my country.
customer_reviews.text: first impression was that the built quality of the equipment is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Work fine at first, the break down after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Unpleased customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I’d hoped for
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a grinder to grind up to a pound of beans at a time. This was much too slow and very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Fraser-Corp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grind
customer_reviews.text: Highly efficient coffee grinder which grinds coffee quickly and with little effort. Yes, it is expensive but, as a treat to myself it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bluemoon

customer_reviews.title: first one arrived busted - second one works great - the morning coffee much better and quieter - ...
customer_reviews.text: first one arrived busted - second one works great - the morning coffee much better and quieter - get it
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nothing says coffee snob without actually saying coffee like this piece of work right here
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is perfect for espresso yet look elsewhere if you also enjoy ...
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is perfect for espresso yet look elsewhere if you also enjoy the french press. The grind is just too fine. Odd that this it has 30 settings but not ideal for drip and French. I had to return my Baratza after it quit running after four weeks. D*mn thing wouldn’t even turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Crews

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for espresso
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my game and so far, it's been great. I don't fully trust Amazon reviews, but combined with high reviews on Whole Latte Love and CoffeeGeek, I went with it. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for the price! It’s relatively loud, but shot to shot accuracy is tight. Timed grinds are producing super consistent shots at +- a tenth or two. Definitely happy, considering the reasonable price. I sometimes long for more settings, but I can always add the fine adjustment ring from the sette 270 (you can purchase from Baratza and add it on to this machine). Glad I purchased this! So far, I’ve made do with the machine as is. Very consistent grinds.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Works very nicely for the last 6 months. I haven’t had to tighten up my perfect setting. Hack: it will hold your shot cup if you rotate the handle 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Should have read up on this more before purchasing it!
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this I had to send it back because it does not grind French Press nor drip - only various grinds of espresso. This was disappointing. I should have read the fine print, before buying! Unfortunately, I lost money on the deal because I wasn’t refunded for the entire purchase, because I had used the machine :-( I am happy, now, because I reordered another brand that is PERFECT and grinds French Press up to Espresso and everything in between! Since I did use it I can say that it isn’t as user friendly as some of the other brands. It’s also very noisy!
customer_reviews.author: yolanda a. rossbach

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is much cheaper than the original, almost as cheap as its little brother, the Virtuoso. It is much faster at grinding than the old geared-down burr grinders. It is aimed primarily at espresso folks, yet I am a pour over guy. So I had to buy the coarser burr and swap out the one that comes with it. Even with the coarser burr, I set it all the way coarse and sieve out the fines. Doing it that way works for me. It has about the lowest grinds left in the burr of any grinder, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Nomer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well. Then died just out of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Until it didn’t. Bought in Dec 2018 for home use. Expensive but I like my coffee. Today it just stopped. No lights. No nothing. Checked power. Chord. Etc. its just dead. And out of warranty by 5 months. I expected better quality. .
customer_reviews.author: Earl Gray

customer_reviews.title: Nice airy fluffy output no clumps just smooth out flat ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit loud. Very quick to fill double basket of decaf espresso. Nice airy fluffy output no clumps just smooth out flat tamp and go. 95% of mazzer mini quality grounds-wise so far in 3 months. No complaints all happy here.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was better. Too many fines.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this grinder. Gave it a very fair shake and tried dialing it in over a few lbs of various coffees. If using it for espresso only it can work if you stick w a pressurized basket or get the dose close enough w the double spouted portafilter. In the end it produces way too many fines for a naked basket or pour overs. A bummer for sure for what I needed. It does look nice though. Guess I’m back to hand grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Shaggy

customer_reviews.title: ... have been using the Sette30 for a month and love it. I wanted to use for Cold Brewed ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Sette30 for a month and love it. I wanted to use for Cold Brewed and French press coffee. I was upset to learn it ONLY grinds for espresso! You must by a different BURR set to do French press. It will not grind coarse enough for Cold Brewed, so has limited use. Great for Espresso. Set at 21 for 4.4 secs was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jay C. Borstein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a quality, yet inexpensive grinder to make expresso ground. The directions tell you the exact setting you need. I instead selected a finer grind and it wouldn't work in my Delongi expresso maker. I then set the grind to the recommended setting and get a perfect espresso grind. What more need be said?
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Leahey

customer_reviews.title: No better power grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: No better power grinder for the money, and made espresso a much quicker process than the old Hario hand grinder I had used for a few years. If you have the money for it, step up to the more adjustable version, as this one seems to be like about a half gram of coffee between clicks, but it works fine for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great for Aeropress with the BG burr
customer_reviews.text: I love it, though I wish it had a pulse grind setting. It's so nice not dealing with retained grinds with this reasonably affordable grind-through design. I do Aeropress with the BG burr from Baratza, which for my fairly fast brew, I'm at around setting 11. I didn't try using the AP burr that comes by default yet, so I can't comment on how coarse that goes. It is a little loud, but not outrageously so, and it grinds quickly. (~7s total, for me) The grinds cup works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown Artist

customer_reviews.title: OK-Ish Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder isn't the most accurate grinder I have ever used but for the price it's really not too bad. This grinder operates off of a timer, but dispenses a drastically different amount of grounds each time it’s used. Though this grinder can grind fine enough for espresso you’ll need to add or remove grounds after every use to get a consistent amount of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff_B

customer_reviews.title: Works for espresso grind, go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Have an old LA pavoni espresso maker, and the cheaper grinders were just not doing the job. So, it works. Yes, you will need to adjust grind with different beans, but so what. It will let you make those adjustments. And it did not cost $500. Works for me. I grind straight into the filter, and deal with the little mess it makes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pagnotta

customer_reviews.title: Best high end grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: My Braun finally died and I loved it. Truth is for a semi serious expresso machine, the Sette 30 is the least you should consider. I am at #12 of 31 and it's fine really fine grind. Noise is not as bad as stated. Very happy to go with my Rancillio Sylvia.
customer_reviews.author: orrink

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate grinding size. Fast.
customer_reviews.text: My coffee and espresso tastes better because of this grinder. It grinds the beans to very even size, which makes the drink tastes smooth.
customer_reviews.author: ScottS

customer_reviews.title: Loud and poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 10 days. Good service from Anaxon and Sette but I needed better reliability. Returned for full refund. Very loud
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder will give you precisely the grind you want for espresso. I have it on 10 and the grind is fine enough for standard espresso machines.
customer_reviews.author: William A. McNair

customer_reviews.title: Good size, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good grinder. Enjoying the size and that it fits on my coffee bar. Grinds fantastic espresso. Only downside is that it is very loud!
customer_reviews.author: Prissygirl93631

customer_reviews.title: Wtf?
customer_reviews.text: The top of it came popped out when I received it. May return. Will update my review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Reptar Richard Vixen

customer_reviews.title: The new gold standard in entry level home espresso grinders.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder can choke a Lelit “Anna” PL41TEM on the 15 setting, right out of the box. It’s doubtful to me that upgrading to the 270 would have really given me that much of a difference in shot quality. I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Flack

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Grinds up the beans very quickly with excellent adjustments for the grind.
customer_reviews.author: shad

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what it is designed for. Reliable and consistent in the measurements.
customer_reviews.author: nemesis

customer_reviews.title: Consistant and efficient grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder for espresso grind. Low retention makes switching from regular to decaf easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich E

product_meta.title: Baratza Sette 30 Conical Burr Grinder
feature_bullets: SPECIALTY COFFEE ASSOCIATION AWARD WINNING GRINDERS - Baratza grinders are preferred by coffee professionals and backed by Baratza’s world class support.
ENTRY LEVEL HOME GRINDER - Capable of grinding for espresso and for brewing methods requiring a finer grind (eg Aeropress, Hario V60, Chemex, some drip brewers).
DIGITAL TIMER - With resolution to .1 of a second, giving you precise control over how much coffee you need.
30 GRIND SETTINGS - User friendly grind adjustment. High speed grinding up to 5g/second and minimal retention in the innovative straight-thru grind mechanism.

WARRANTY/QUALITY PARTS - Built with quality parts the industry has come to expect, including burrs manufactured in Europe. This combination creates a consistent grind and durability ensuring the longevity users have come to expect from the Baratza brand. The Sette 30 is backed by Baratza’s world class support and a 1 year warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars215 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
